intro: Erigeron squarrosus, commonly known as the woolly fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its fuzzy, gray-green leaves and daisy-like yellow flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky areas. It produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron squarrosus is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
